text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide recommendations.celida.codex.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de

CELIDARecommendations

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://www.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de/fhir/codex-celida/ImplementationGuide/recommendations.celida.codex.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: Abdominal Positioning
resource.description: In ARDS and a PaO2/FiO2 < 150 mmHg, abdominal positioning should be consistently performed, with an abdominal positioning interval of at least 16 hours.

resource.name: Abdominal positioning for ventilated patients with ARDS and a PaO2/FiO2 < 150 mmHg
resource.description: Abdominal positioning for ventilated patients with ARDS and a PaO2/FiO2 < 150 mmHg

resource.name: Abdominal positioning plan in case of ARDS and a PaO2/FiO2 < 150 mmHg
resource.description: In ARDS and a PaO2/FiO2 < 150 mmHg, abdominal positioning should be consistently performed, with an abdominal positioning interval of at least 16 hours.

resource.name: Anticoagulation Plan for hospitalized intensive-care COVID-19 patients with no specific indication
resource.description: In intensive care patients without a specific indication (e.g. pulmonary embolism), therapeutic anticoagulation should not be given.

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Certoparin
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Certoparin in hospitalised COVID-19 patients (in absence of contraindications for LWMH)

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Dalteparin
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Dalteparin in hospitalised COVID-19 patients (in absence of contraindications for LWMH)

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Enoxaparin
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Enoxaparin in hospitalised COVID-19 patients (in absence of contraindications for LWMH)

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Fondaparinux
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Fondaparinux in hospitalised COVID-19 patients

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Fondaparinux
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Fondaparinux in hospitalised COVID-19 patients (when contraindications for LWMH exist)

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with LWMH
resource.description: Hospitalized patients with COVID-19 should receive standard drug thromboembolism prophylaxis with low molecular weight heparin in the absence of contraindications. Alternatively, fondaparinux may be used.

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Nadroparin
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Nadroparin in hospitalised COVID-19 patients (in absence of contraindications for LWMH)

resource.name: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Tinzaparin
resource.description: Antithrombotic prophylaxis with Tinzaparin in hospitalised COVID-19 patients

resource.name: CODEX-CELIDA
resource.description: Concepts required in recommendations that are not defined elsewhere

resource.name: Hospitalised COVID-19 patients, treated on ICU, without thrombembolic complication
resource.description: Hospitalised COVID-19 patients, treated on ICU, without thrombembolic complication

resource.name: KontaktArtDe
resource.description: Klassifizierung eines Kontaktes mit einer Gesundheitseinrichtung

resource.name: Therapeutic Anticoagulation Plan (hospitalised, non-intensive care, COVID-19 patients with no renal function impairment (eGFR >= 30ml/min))
resource.description: In hospitalized, non-intensive care patients with COVID-19 and increased risk (e.g., D-dimers ≥ 2 mg/l), therapeutic anticoagulation can be considered if the risk of bleeding is low. Anticoagulation, preferentially with NMH or UFH, can be considered.

resource.name: Therapeutic Anticoagulation Treatment UFH
resource.description: Therapeutic Anticoagulation Treatment (UFH) for non-intensive care hospitalised COVID-19 patients patients with high risk (D-Dimer >= 2mg/l)

resource.name: Tidal volume / end-inspiratory airway pressure for ventilated COVID-19 patients with ARDS
resource.description: Tidal volume / end-inspiratory airway pressure for ventilated COVID-19 patients with ARDS

resource.name: Tidal volume for ventilated patients with ARDS
resource.description: Tidal volume for ventilated patients with ARDS

resource.name: Ventilation Plan for COVID-19 patients with ARDS
resource.description: In ventilated patients with COVID-19 and ARDS, tidal volume should be ≤ 6 ml/kg standard body weight, end-inspiratory airway pressure ≤ 30 cm H2O.

resource.name: Ventilation Plan for patients with ARDS
resource.description: We recommend ventilating patients with ARDS with a VT ≤ 6 ml/kg standard body weight (bw). (Table 1, Appendix)
